channel.title: MySQL [Read + Help] [Please]
channel.description:
Problem: I'm trying to make it so you must be registered on forums to play on my server. Reason: I would like to learn something more than commands or object cases, for once.
Need help: With it all. I have no idea where to start. Please: Do it for me, but step by step, telling me what you did, so I can learn.
Thanks.

No you would get REAL java help, your supposed to help yourself, you would not find a topic on here or anywhere me asking for help without me googling it first.

item.title: MySQL [Read + Help] [Please]
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

Make it so no-one can see your forums when they go to the website, Make a board saying “Proof of Registration” , Then if a person joins your server, Tell Him/Her to register then post a topic the the Proof of Registration page and if they do so Let them on the server, if the don’t kick them a couple of times until they do, XD ROFL thats the easiest way but by far the worst XD.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL [Read + Help] [Please]
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Hmm…I could probably make it so my forum saves the file to my server folder, too. Then make it so you can’t register from the server…But could you tell me what I would need so you have to be already created to play?

I’m looking for something like this:

if (PlayerHandler.playerCount > 10 && playerRights < 2) { returnCode = 7; savefile = false; disconnected = true; }

What would,something like that, look like so if your not already created, you don’t log in?

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL [Read + Help] [Please]
item.dc:creator: @i_own_pking i_own_pking
item.description:
@i_own_pking wrote:

You don’t need to have MYSQL for this…

Just code a php script that saves a character file into your server character folder.

Then to make it so only they cant log in im not going to tell you how only hint you.

Look in your run.bat when a new user logs in, thats a big hint… to do with creating a file
